title: Manipur: Armed men attack paramilitary vehicle; 2 soldiers killed, at least 3 hurt
content: In Manipur's Bishnupur district, a paramilitary vehicle was ambushed by armed men, resulting in the death of two Army jawans and injuries to at least three others. The Assam Rifles personnel were travelling from Imphal towards Bishnupur when the attack occurred in the Nambol Sabal Leikai area.

title: 'Didn't mean to ignore pain of terror': Cong's Pitroda on 'Pak' remark; what was his aim?
content: Sam Pitroda clarified his remarks about feeling "at home" in Pakistan, emphasizing shared history and people-to-people bonds, not minimizing terrorism. His statement sparked controversy, drawing sharp reactions from BJP leaders who criticized his proximity to Pakistan, especially after the Pahalgam terror attack. Pitroda, a longtime aide of the Gandhi family, has a history of controversial statements.

title: Why was Indian techie shot dead by US police? 10 things to know
content: The death of Mohammed Nizamuddin in California sparks controversy. Police claim he attacked his roommate and posed a threat. His family alleges excessive force and delayed notification. Nizamuddin had accused his employer of racial discrimination. The Indian consulate offers assistance. His family seeks government intervention to bring his body back to India for final rites.

title: Tech investor Warren Buffett won’t upgrade his car; says simplicity matters
content: Warren Buffett, the billionaire, values time over luxury. He still drives his 11-year-old Cadillac. He sees cars as tools, not status symbols. His daughter bought the car for him. Buffett avoids wasting time on car shopping. He prefers reading and investing. His approach reflects his investment strategy. He buys quality and holds long. He finds happiness in simplicity.

title: How Trump and MAGA rebranded 'cancel culture' into 'consequence culture'
content: When Donald Trump swept back into the White House in January 2025, he cast himself as the man who would rescue America from “cancel culture.” He promised to dismantle censorship, restore free speech, and end what he described as a coordinated campaign by Democrats and Silicon Valley to muzzle conservatives.

title: Zubeen Garg death: Himanta says coordinating with Singapore to bring back body
content: Assam mourns the tragic death of Zubeen Garg, the celebrated singer, who passed away at 52 in a scuba diving accident in Singapore. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma led tributes, lamenting the loss of Assam's favorite son and a cultural icon. Garg, known for his versatility in Assamese, Hindi, and Bengali music, was in Singapore for the North East Festival.

title: Heated! Afridi blasts Irfan Pathan: 'I don't consider him a man'
content: Shahid Afridi has refuted Irfan Pathan's account of a mid-air argument during India's 2006 tour of Pakistan, labeling Pathan's claims as fabricated. Afridi questioned Pathan's intentions, suggesting he's trying to prove that he's Indian. He challenged Pathan to confront him directly, dismissing the alleged incident as a lie supported by Abdul Razzaq's denial.

title: Recession risk high: Moody’s Zandi warns on US economy; says DOGE
content: Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody’s Analytics, suggests the US economy is nearing a recession due to policy missteps and speculative market behavior. Tariffs, immigration restrictions, and Federal Reserve decisions are major headwinds, causing uncertainty and delaying business investments.

title: 'Silence is acceptance': BJP slams Cong over Pitroda's ‘felt at home in Pak’ remark
content: BJP on Friday attacked the Congress after Sam Pitroda said he “felt at home” in Pakistan. BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari called the remark anti-national and insulting to soldiers, alleging Congress has a “soft corner” for Pakistan. He cited past links with terrorists and accused Rahul Gandhi of silence. The BJP demanded the Gandhi family apologise.

title: No Pak, yes to handshakes! India captain hugs Oman counterpart - Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav embraced Jatinder Singh at the Asia Cup 2025 toss. Jatinder presented a gift to Suryakumar, marking a historic moment for Oman cricket. India won the toss and chose to bat first. Suryakumar explained the decision, emphasizing the importance of game time. India made two changes to their team.

title: Embarrassing! India captain forgets changes at toss: 'I've become Rohit Sharma'
content: Ahead of the Asia Cup match against Oman, India's captain Suryakumar Yadav created a humorous moment at the toss. Having already qualified, India aimed to test their squad's depth by batting first. While announcing the changes, Suryakumar hilariously forgot the name of Arshdeep Singh, who replaced Jasprit Bumrah, likening himself to Rohit Sharma.

title: xAI's final exam: Elon Musk tests loyalty; 24 hours to verdict
content: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their past accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight deadline amidst company turbulence. This demand follows Musk's pattern of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: 'Keep mutual interests in mind': MEA message to Saudi, Pak; pact raises alarm
content: India acknowledged its extensive strategic alliance with Saudi Arabia, emphasizing its recent strengthening, while commenting on the newly formed Saudi-Pakistan defense agreement. India hopes the partnership respects mutual interests, as the pact sparks speculation about Saudi access to Pakistan's nuclear capabilities amid Middle East tensions. The agreement, uniting Saudi finance and Pakistani military might, raises questions about regional security dynamics.

title: AIIMS NORCET 2025: Paper-leak allegations rock exam; tech chaos adds fuel
content: The Nursing Officer Recruitment Common Eligibility Test (NORCET) 2025 has come under intense scrutiny following allegations that around 60% of preliminary exam questions circulated on social media. Technical glitches, including prolonged system failures in Jammu, added to candidate frustration. With echoes of the 2023 controversy, nursing associations are demanding an urgent investigation and stronger safeguards to protect the exam’s integrity.

title: Handshake row gets murkier: PCB responds to ICC; but gets facts wrong
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has responded to the ICC's concerns regarding potential PMOA violations during a recent match. The PCB defended its media manager's actions, claiming authorised access and adherence to ICC protocols, while the ICC raised objections to filming a sensitive meeting and alleged blackmail. The situation remains tense, potentially leading to further action from the ICC.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle: Private escape — cottage now revealed
content: Lauren Kyle McDavid, wife of Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid, is featured in ELLE Canada, showcasing her lakeside cottage. The interior designer, entrepreneur, and founder of Kyle & Co Design highlights a space that blends European elegance with modern simplicity, as her retreat reflects her love for entertaining. Along with thoughtful design details, she creates a warm, welcoming atmosphere.

title: Caitlin Clark’s playoff hopes dim: Fever shake-up — injury recovery lingers
content: Caitlin Clark will miss the WNBA Playoffs due to injuries. Indiana Fever advanced by defeating Atlanta Dream. Clark's absence is a setback after quad and ankle injuries. She expresses disappointment but thanks fans for their support. The Fever will face either Las Vegas Aces or Seattle Storm. Clark focuses on recovery for a return in 2026.

title: Chrissy Teigen opens up, says Ozempic helped after son’s loss, calls it a miracle drug
content: Chrissy Teigen revealed using Ozempic to cope with deep depression following a stillbirth in 2020, noting weight gain exacerbated her grief. While Ozempic aided in weight loss and eased her mental burden, she acknowledged challenges like appetite suppression.

title: Oscars: 'Homebound' named India's official entry in Best I'national Feature category
content: The Hindi film 'Homebound,' a story of childhood friends aspiring to be police officers, has been selected as India's official entry for the 2026 Academy Awards in the Best International Feature category. The film received a warm reception at the Toronto Film Festival, securing the second runner-up position for the TIFF People's Choice International Award.

title: Inside Hajj 2026: Where to stay, eat and how to plan your pilgrimage days
content: Congratulations to those selected for Hajj 2026! Scheduled around May 24-29, planning is crucial. Indians can choose Nusuk packages or the Haj Committee route, with options for hotels near the Grand Mosque or Mina/Arafat tents. Pilgrims can expect Indian cuisine in Makkah and Madinah, alongside light Arabic fare.

title: Colon cancer: THIS medication slashes risk of colorectal cancer recurrence
content: A groundbreaking study reveals that a daily low dose of aspirin can significantly reduce the risk of colorectal cancer recurrence by approximately 55% in patients with specific PI3K pathway mutations. The ALASCCA trial demonstrated that aspirin, when taken for three years post-surgery, offers substantial benefits for those with these genetic alterations.

title: 'Wasn't my night': First note for fans! Neeraj opens up on Tokyo disappointment
content: Neeraj Chopra, battling back pain, finished eighth at the World Championships in Tokyo with a throw of 84.03 meters, a disappointing end to his season. Sachin Yadav outperformed him, securing fourth place with 86.27 meters. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold, followed by Anderson Peters and Curtis Thompson.

title: Serena Williams’ net worth 2025: Tennis legacy, deals — business ventures grow
content: Serena Williams, a tennis icon, boasts a net worth of $350 million in 2025. Her wealth comes from tennis wins, endorsements, and business ventures. She supports businesses run by women and people of color through Serena Ventures. Recently, she invested in Unrivaled, a women’s basketball league. Serena also launched a podcast with her sister, Venus.

title: ‘No faith in Constitution’: Fadnavis targets Rahul; terms him 'urban maoist'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of echoing "urban Maoist" sentiments. Fadnavis alleges Gandhi is inciting Generation Z to overthrow the democratically elected government and disregards the Constitution. This reaction follows Gandhi's renewed allegations of election irregularities and his call for youth to defend democracy, intensifying the political clash between the leaders.

title: Worst-ever! Neeraj Chopra suffers nightmare: Numbers in last 7 years
content: Neeraj Chopra endured his worst finish since 2018, placing eighth at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo with a best throw of 84.03m. The Olympic and World Champion, who has consistently medalled at global events over the past seven years, admitted to back issues that hampered his performance. A look at his results since 2018 highlights how rare such an outcome is for India’s javelin superstar.

title: Asia Cup: Timeline of handshake row - ICC pulls up PCB over PMOA violation
content: The Asia Cup 2025 is embroiled in controversy after India's refusal to shake hands with Pakistan sparked a major standoff. The PCB demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft, delaying a match against the UAE. The ICC accused PCB of protocol breaches, including unauthorised recording within the PMOA.

title: Hair growth tips: Yoga poses that boost scalp blood flow; experts explain how
content: Battling hair thinning or slow growth? Incorporate yoga into your routine! Certain poses boost scalp circulation, delivering vital nutrients to hair follicles. Downward-Facing Dog, Forward Fold, and Headstands are beneficial. Even Fish Pose helps! Combine these with healthy habits for stronger, shinier hair. A few minutes daily can transform your hair care, naturally.

title: Singer Zubeen Garg passes away at 52 in scuba diving accident in Singapore
content: Assamese singer Zubeen Garg tragically passed away at 52 in Singapore due to a scuba diving accident. He was scheduled to perform at the North East Festival. Zubeen was widely celebrated for his contributions to music across various languages, including his Bollywood hit 'Ya Ali'. His sudden demise has prompted an outpouring of grief from fans and prominent figures.

title: Connor McDavid in doubt: Oilers risk it again — no long-term deal yet
content: Connor McDavid's future with the Edmonton Oilers beyond 2026 remains uncertain, casting a shadow over the team's Stanley Cup aspirations. McDavid emphasizes his decision hinges on "a feeling," sparking both hope and unease among fans after recent final heartbreaks. With roster questions and goaltending concerns, McDavid's patience depends on management's ability to build a championship-caliber team.

title: 'Was fed up, wanted to take sanyas': Sheena Bora's childhood friend; email texts cited
content: Sheena Bora, allegedly murdered by Indrani Mukerjea, expressed a desire for 'sanyas' due to life's problems, according to a childhood friend's testimony, citing old emails. The friend, a prosecution witness, shared Bora's plans to marry Rahul Mukerjea and her strained relationship with Indrani. Communication ceased abruptly after a text about breaking up with Rahul.

title: Fact check: Are handshakes mandatory in cricket? What does the rulebook say?
content: Former international umpire Anil Chaudhary suggests that the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) recent controversies during the Asia Cup were a diversionary tactic following their loss to India. These controversies included boycott threats, disputes with ICC match referee Andy Pycroft, and a handshake disagreement with India, sparked by strained relations after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: George Kittle Under Fire: From fake Kirk quote to viral backlash; critics say 'no place in NFL'
content: George Kittle, the San Francisco 49ers' tight end, recently refuted a fabricated quote attributed to him regarding Charlie Kirk and politics in the NFL. Kittle took to Instagram to clarify the misinformation after a Facebook post went viral, emphasizing the importance of verifying information online. He is currently on injured reserve but is expected to return on October 12.

title: 'Ex-PM conveyed gratitude': Yasin Malik's major claim on meeting Hafiz Saeed; calls case 'betrayal'
content: Yasin Malik, jailed JKLF chief, claims he met with Lashkar-e-Taiba founder Hafiz Saeed in 2006 at the request of IB, as part of a backchannel peace process. Malik alleges that then Prime Minister Manmohan Singh expressed gratitude for his efforts.

title: Bengaluru civic apathy continues: Another school van gets stuck in open drain
content: In Bengaluru, a school minivan carrying children got stuck in an open drain on Panathur-Bellandur road, fortunately without injuries. This incident follows a series of accidents on the same stretch, including a school bus partially toppling and other vehicles sinking into slush-filled craters.

title: Stabbed, stripped, extorted: Woman sexually harassed inside B'luru PG; accused arrested
content: A 37-year-old man allegedly stabbed and sexually harassed a 24-year-old woman at a PG in Bengaluru’s Whitefield, demanding money and transferring  Rs 14,000 from her account. He was later assaulted by PG staff, leading to cross-complaints. Police have arrested the accused, Sai Babu Chennuru, and registered cases of attempt to murder, sexual harassment, extortion, and assault.

title: Man throws chilli powder in his daughter’s eyes, later stabs her to death
content: In Gwalior's Janakganj, a shocking incident unfolded as Badam Singh Kushwaha allegedly murdered his 24-year-old daughter, Rani Kushwaha. Police reports indicate that Singh, fueled by a long-standing family dispute and alcohol addiction, attacked Rani with chili powder before fatally stabbing her. The mother stated that Rani often objected to his behavior.

title: Zomato delivery boy attacked in Bengaluru over delayed food delivery
content: In Bengaluru's Bapuji Nagar, a Zomato delivery executive was reportedly assaulted by two individuals on September 14 due to a delayed food delivery. The dispute escalated when the order arrived late, resulting in the delivery boy sustaining minor injuries. Police are awaiting a formal complaint from the victim to initiate a full investigation into the incident.

title: Exclusive | Jaismine Lamboria's story: COVID, setbacks to World Champion!
content: Jaismine Lamboria, hailing from Bhiwani, overcame early setbacks, including a disappointing Olympic debut and health challenges, to clinch gold at the World Boxing Championships. Inspired by her family's boxing legacy, particularly her great-grandfather Hawa Singh, she shifted her focus to performance over results.

title: Heat's Herro to miss start of season after surgery
content: Heat All-Star Tyler Herro will undergo surgery on his left foot Friday and will be sidelined to start the 2025-26 season.

title: Rampage's son, Raja, arrested on assault charge
content: Raja Jackson, son of former UFC champion Quinton "Rampage" Jackson, has been arrested in Los Angeles on a felony assault charge stemming from his attack of a pro wrestler.

title: Agent: Kuminga prepared to take qualifying offer
content: Jonathan Kuminga's agent told ESPN that Kuminga -- who is seeking a player option -- is prepared to take the $7.9 million qualifying offer unless the Golden State Warriors improve their current offers.

title: Lyles wins 200 again; Jefferson-Wooden sweeps
content: Noah Lyles pulled ahead of Kenny Bednarek then held him off down the stretch to capture his fourth world title in the 200 meters, while Melissa Jefferson-Wooden completed the first women's 100-200 double at worlds since Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce.

title: U.S. hurdler wins worlds gold as DQ overturned
content: American Rai Benjamin was declared the winner of the 400-meter hurdles at the world championships after officials overrode an initial disqualification for slightly dislodging a hurdle in the lane next to him when he knocked over his own.

title: Source: Ole Miss QB Simmons unlikely to play
content: Ole Miss quarterback Austin Simmons has been limited all week in practice and is unlikely to contribute significantly against Tulane on Saturday, a source told ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: Witness in 2006 Miami murder case found alive
content: It's unclear how the revelation about witness Paul Conner will affect the murder trial of Rashaun Jones, currently set to start Oct. 6.

title: NFL: Officiate tush push 'tight' after missed call
content: The NFL said the Eagles should have been flagged for at least one false start when they used the tush push against the Chiefs on Sunday and instructed officials this week to call the controversial play "tight."

title: 🍿 Young, Beverley trade words over All-Star effort
content: The exchange between the Atlanta Hawks guard and 12-year NBA pro intensified Wednesday, capped off by a post from the Hawks on Thursday.

title: WWE Wrestlepalooza on ESPN: Cena-Lesnar to kick off the show
content: We break down the major Wrestlepalooza storylines, including John Cena vs. Brock Lesnar and the return of AJ Lee. Coverage starts at 5 p.m. ET Saturday in the ESPN App.

title: Satou Sabally dug deep to push Mercury to Game 3 vs. Liberty
content: After a dismal shooting performance in Game 1, Satou Sabally cited books and belief for her bounce-back in Game 2. She'll write the next chapter in Game 3.

title: Semifinals preview and predictions: Can Fever topple Aces and pull another upset?
content: Half of the semifinal bracket is set. How do Indiana and Las Vegas match up, and which team is the favorite?

title: Clayton Kershaw's final act: Why even his opponents are collecting souvenirs
content: The future Hall of Famer will make his final regular-season start at Dodger Stadium tonight. It won't just be special in the home clubhouse.

title: The sneaky Big Ten game, the hyped-but-struggling QBs and more in Week 4
content: An unusual Big Ten showdown, a fun Big 12 headliner and a bunch of QBs looking to get right on tap this weekend.

title: Manning leads list of QBs falling short, plus breakout players, top quotes
content: Ahead of Week 4, we take a look at big conference matchups, quarterbacks who have room to grow, plus quotes.

title: Doncic's summer transformation signals Lakers' new era
content: After a historic summer on the court and massive changes off it, Doncic has sent a message to the NBA. And his new team responded in kind.

title: Our first look at the NFL trade deadline: Candidates to move, plus teams that could be active
content: The NFL trade deadline isn't until Nov. 4, but we're looking ahead. Could Tyreek Hill or Kirk Cousins be moved? Which teams might make deals?

title: Don't be surprised if ... Chase remains No. 1, Dobbins runs for 1,000
content: Discussing the Browning-Chase connection and what to believe (and not believe) from early-season action.

title: A deep dive into the mysterious Platypus Trophy of the Oregon-Oregon State rivalry
content: The story behind one of college football's most unusual trophies, which is an image of a most unusual animal.

title: Champions League overreactions: Arsenal are England's best hope
content: One round of Champions League games won't teach us everything we need to know. Reserved reactions are smart, but they're also no fun. Let's overreact!

title: Thompson, Bedard, Keller, others using 4 Nations snubs as Olympic motivation
content: NHL players will participate in the Games for the first time since 2014, with rosters revealed in January.

title: Dalvin Cook meets Caleb Williams? How Tyriq Withers brought Cameron Cade to life
content: Tyriq Withers pulled from his own experience as a walk-on at FSU and working with quarterback guru Jordan Palmer to cultivate his character in the Jordan Peele-produced horror film.

title: Which 0-2 teams still have a shot at the playoffs? Barnwell ranks all 10 by turnaround likelihood
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: A'ja Wilson vs. Napheesa Collier: The moments that reshaped the WNBA MVP race
content: What appeared to be a foregone conclusion in July turned into a hotly contested WNBA MVP race. What changed?

title: Why the champs and four other teams control the future of the NBA draft
content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

title: Will Raleigh finish strong? Can Astros score without Alvarez? 5 things that will decide the AL West race
content: The Mariners and Astros are about to face off with the division title and playoff seeding on the line. Here's what will determine the race.

title: What to know ahead of the Azerbaijan Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 ventures to Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan for round 17 of the 2025 season. Here's everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Atlético, Barça eye Vlahovic
content: Manchester United, Atlético Madrid and Barcelona are keeping tabs on Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: UWCL draw reaction: Good for Chelsea, Barcelona; bad for Man United; must-see games
content: The Women's Champions League is back! So let's unpack all the must-see games, winners and losers, and talking points from Friday's draw for the 2025-26 league phase.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Karuvannur bank releases ₹10,000 to elderly woman ‘mocked’ by Suresh Gopi
content: When she sought the Union Minister’s help at a public interaction to retrieve her deposit from the scam-hit bank, he had asked her to approach the Chief Minister instead

title: Cancer survivor meets his stem cell donor
content: Infosys employee Vishnu Venugopal donates stem cell to 17-year-old Adinarayanan, thus giving him a new life

title: Assam Rifles vehicle attacked in Manipur, 2 jawans killed
content: Militants of People’s Liberation Army (PLA), a valley-based banned insurgent group, is suspected to be behind the attack, sources said

title: Thoothukudi asphyxiation death: ballast tank had a crack
content: The workers were trying to pump out the water so that the crack could be repaired, shipping officials investigating the accident say

title: Kerala-EU partnership can help expand trade, market access: Union Fisheries Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh
content: He says expanding access to EU market, particularly for shrimp, will generate additional employment and foreign exchange, directly benefiting coastal communities and seafood processors across the country

title: Digital mapping begins to record rivulets in rural areas of Kozhikode
content: The project is being carried out with the support of the Haritha Keralam Mission, with Kunnamangalam block panchayat included in the first phase

title: Din in Thrissur council as Opposition alleges bid to privatise Corporation’s electricity wing
content: Local Self-Government department had  issued an order reducing sanctioned posts in the electricity wing from 229 to 103, which  the Opposition says will hinder its functioning.  Leader of the Opposition Rajan J. Pallan alleges move by LDF-led civic administration and government to privatise wing

title: Veeyapuram Chundan wins opening race of CBL-5
content: Melpadom Chundan, powered by the PBC, finishes a close second, while Niranom Chundan, rowed by the NBC, secures third place

title: ₹61.48 lakh imposed as fine in one year for waste dumping reported through WhatsApp in Kerala
content: The highest number of violations were reported through WhatsApp from Thiruvananthapuram and Ernakulam districts

title: 61-year-old woman goes missing after losing ₹11 lakh to cyber scammers
content: She was the victim of a cyber fraud in which she was swindled of ₹11 lakh, which she raised by pledging her gold with the help of a neighbour.

title: TTD completes micro-level planning for annual Brahmotsavams beginning September 24
content: All arrangements are in place to ensure devotees have a smooth, hassle-free darshan, says TTD Executive Officer A.K. Singhal

title: NDTV's Front-Row Seat To Tejas' Flight Into History
content: The smell of new paint lingers in the air as rows of Tejas aircraft, the made-in-India fighter jets, are lined on the shop floor of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) in Bengaluru, all set to fly.

title: "Aim Wasn't To Belittle Suffering": Sam Pitroda Clarifies Pak Remark Amid Row
content: Congress's Sam Pitroda, mired deep in another controversy after his "at home in neighbouring countries" remark, has issued a clarification.

title: After Op Sindoor, Pak Terrorists Shifting To This Remote Region To Rebuild
content: Following India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted and destroyed nine major terrorist hideouts across Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) and mainland Pakistan, groups long embedded in the country have begun relocating.

title: Adani Group Adds Rs 69,000 Crore In Market Cap After SEBI Order
content: Shares in Adani Group companies surged on Friday after markets regulator SEBI cleared the conglomerate of allegations made by US short-seller Hindenburg Research.

title: Video: Another School Bus Gets Stuck In Drain In Bengaluru, Second Incident In A Day
content: Bengaluru's battered roads continue to pose a serious threat to the people, with a third incident involving a school vehicle reported within a week and the second in a single day.

title: Iran Withdraws Draft Resolution To Ban Attacks On Nuclear Facilities
content: Iran late Thursday withdrew a draft resolution at the UN nuclear watchdog that called for a ban on attacks against nuclear facilities after its war with Israel, citing US pressure for the last-minute change.

title: Woman, 24, Stabs Boyfriend To Death After Fight Over Marriage In Jharkhand: Cops
content: A 24-year-old woman allegedly stabbed her boyfriend to death following a fight over their marriage in Jharkhand's Chatra district, police said on Friday.

title: Poll Panel On Cleanup Mode, 808 Inactive Political Parties Delisted
content: The Election Commission of India has stepped up its efforts to remove inactive political parties from its records. The Commission has delisted 808 Registered Unrecognised Political Parties that have not contested elections in 6 years.

title: PM Modi To Launch Development Projects Worth Rs 34,200 Crore From Gujarat
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will participate in the "Samudra se Samriddhi" event in Gujarat on Saturday and launch multiple development projects worth more than Rs 34,200 crore from Bhavnagar.

title: Israel Army Says Will Use 'Unprecedented Force' In Gaza City
content: The Israeli military warned on Friday that it would operate with "unprecedented force" in Gaza City, urging residents to flee southwards while announcing the closure of a temporary evacuation route opened 48 hours earlier.

title: Ajit Pawar On Why He Split Up With Uncle Sharad Pawar
content: Ajit Pawar, the Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra said today that he parted ways with his uncle Sharad Pawar to "ensure stability and progress in Maharashtra".

title: Trump, Xi Speak On Call Over Agreement To Keep TikTok Online In US
content: Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping spoke by phone on Friday, Chinese state media reported, as they seek an agreement to help keep the video app TikTok online in the US and ease tensions between two superpowers locked in a standoff over trade.

title: 5th Suspect In Firing At Actor Disha Patani's UP House Injured In Encounter
content: The fifth suspect in the firing incident at actor Disha Patani's home in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly last week has been injured in a police encounter today. The encounter took place in the forests of the Shahi police station area in Bareilly.

title: Israel's Ground Assault In Gaza City: What We Know
content: Israel has announced a major ground assault in Gaza City that it says is aimed at crushing Hamas in the Palestinian territory's largest urban hub.

title: RSS, Shankaracharyas, And Secret Talks: Yasin Malik's Fresh Claims
content: Yasin Malik, convicted terrorist and leader of the banned group Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF), has made a series of claims in a detailed affidavit filed before the Delhi High Court, which include past engagements with political figures.

title: Taliban Release Detained Elderly British Couple
content: An elderly British couple detained in Afghanistan for almost eight months were released on Friday, the Taliban authorities said, after pressure built to free the pair due to fears over their health.

title: Rajasthan Government School Teachers Reward Students For Scoring 90%: Air Travel To Daman-Diu
content: In an inspiring example of encouragement, five students from the Government Higher Secondary School in Rajasthan were recently taken on an air journey to Diu-Daman, a reward for scoring above 90% in their Class 12 board exams.

title: Bodies of 2 Girls Found In Well In Jharkhand, Probe Underway: Cops
content: The bodies of two schoolgirls were found in a well in Jharkhand's Giridih district, police said on Friday.

title: On Rahul Gandhi's Message To Gen Z, Devendra Fadnavis' "Urban Naxal" Jab
content: Rahul Gandhi's post on Gen Z and vote theft has infuriated the BJP, which has been heaping criticism on the senior Congress leader.

title: Kerala HC stays MDB order on travel, food expenses of officials attending Global Ayyappa Sangamam
content: The Malabar Devaswom Board’s order had asked temple officials to use the funds from their respective temples to bear the travel and food expenses incurred while attending the conclave

title: KSRTC to introduce one more double-decker service in Munnar
content: Transport utility resumes service of the first bus which has been temporarily suspended after it rammed a waiting shed

title: SCR officers take part in walkathon on ‘Swachhata Hi Seva’ in Vijayawada
content: The SCR has been conducting awareness programmes to educate passengers on proper disposal of waste and the ill-effects of plastic use, says DRM Mohit Sonakiya

title: Public, tourists cautioned against entering elephant camp during Dasara
content: ‘A woman sneaked into the elephant camp on the night of September 18, ventured close to the elephants, took photographs and made reels which were uploaded on social media’

title: Animal rights groups for ban on using live bait to capture big cats
content: The groups have stated that such practices are in violation of animal welfare laws and cause immense trauma to the animal

title: Govt. failed to ensure MSP announced for onion farmers, alleges APCC president Y. S. Sharmila
content: The growers are facing severe financial distress due to record-low market prices, she alleges, and accuses the government of prioritising cinema ticket price hikes

title: BJP worker ‘beaten’ to death in West Bengal’s Nadia; sparks political row
content: Family alleges ruling party’s role in Sanjay Bhowmik’s death; BJP demands accountability, Trinamool denies charges

title: CPI(M) says Antony’s belated ‘contrition’ for Sivagiri and Muthanga police action validates LDF’s stance
content: CPI(M) State secretary says the Congress Legislative Party’s failure to defend the ‘dismal’ track record of the Antony government in the Assembly forced the octogenarian to defend himself

title: Students told to learn about quality standards of products
content: Bureau of Indian Standards organises training for mentors of Standards Clubs on scientific laws and  standardisation, says its Director

title: Kerala sees potential in collaborating with EU to expand opportunities for fisheries sector: CM
content: Blue Economy is one of the most exciting areas for collaboration between Kerala and the EU, which has global leadership in marine technologies, ocean governance, and sustainability frameworks, says Pinarayi

title: Mysuru City police ban toy vuvuzelas ahead of Dasara
content: Several complaints have been received against vuvuzelas or toy trumpets, which caused a disturbance to tourists and public

title: Sharp rise in number of beneficiaries, expenditure under Dr. NTR Vaidya Seva: Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav
content: Aarogyasri scheme has not been stalled, only the name has been changed, the Minister says, adding that the government has not only enhanced its scope but also cleared backlog dues inherited from the previous dispensation

title: Watch: Supreme Court adjourns bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid in Delhi riots case
content: The Supreme Court has once again adjourned the bail pleas of activist Sharjeel Imam, former JNU scholar Umar Khalid, and others accused in the 2020 Delhi riots case, now listed for September 22.

title: Ahead of BTC polls, Bodoland Imam Council asks minorities to shun communal parties
content: The body of imams said the Bharatiya Janata Party and the All India United Democratic Front threaten the unity and harmony of India’s diverse society

title: Chittoor Collector urges officials to empower rural women through skill-building
content: Sumit Kumar calls for strengthening SHGs with training in kitchen gardens, poultry, dairy farming, and modern practices such as drone-based farming and millet promotion

title: Kolkata law college gang-rape case: Student seeks transfer to another institute
content: We received a mail from the family requesting a change of college. We are looking into the matter sympathetically, says Calcutta University's officiating Vice-Chancellor Santa Datta

title: Ayurveda is a way of life, says Prataprao
content: Union Minister launches initiatives ahead of Ayurveda Day 2025, theme focuses on ‘Ayurveda for People & Planet’

title: Karnataka SBI robbery: Police recover 6.54 kg of gold, ₹41.04 lakh in cash from abandoned building
content: As per the complaint, a group of three unidentified miscreants had robbed the branch of around 20 kg of gold and ₹1.4 crore in cash

title: Watch: ‘Look to the Preamble’, Supreme Court clears Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Mysuru Dasara
content: India’s Supreme Court dismissed a petition challenging Karnataka’s decision to have Booker Prize-winning author Banu Mushtaq inaugurate Mysuru Dasara on September 22 at Chamundeshwari temple.

title: Enrollment to State board schools in Karnataka declines by over 5 lakh compared to last year
content: According to data, from 2023-24 to 2025-26, encolment decreased by about 7.26 lakh in government schools.

title: In-charge headmaster of panchayat school booked for assaulting Class 3 boy in Pudukottai
content: Mother too attacked for questioning the headmaster and six persons have been booked under the SC/ST Act

title: Rare surgery performed at KLES hospital
content: Experts at the Department of Neuro and Vascular Interventional Radiology performed a below-knee lithotripsy for peripheral vascular disease

title: Collector outlines plan to boost primary sector in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: Shyam Prasad sets 15% GVA growth target, stressing horticulture expansion, climate-resilient crops, micro-irrigation, and natural farming

title: Dasara holidays for schools in Andhra Pradesh from September 22 to October 2
content: Decision has been taken to this effect after discussing the issue with Education Department officials, says HRD Minister Nara Lokesh

title: Condolences pour in over death of singer Zubeen Garg
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and a host of musicians express condolences over the singer’s death

title: Elaborate security arrangements will be in place for Dasara
content: ‘Necessary measures have been taken to not only maintain law and order and ensure no untoward incident takes place at the different venues of Dasara programmes, but also to facilitate smooth movement of traffic in and around the venues’

title: Navaratri Rangotsava from Sept. 22
content: There will be folk dance troupes performance daily at Vanaranga at 5.30 p.m., while plays will be performed at Bhoomigeetha auditorium at 7 p.m.

title: Writer T. Padamanabhan ridicules circular mandating ‘respected’ before Ministers’ names
content: The writer was speaking at the inauguration of the ‘Walk Against Drugs,’ led by Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala in Kannur

title: Temporary bus stands to be set-up to regulate traffic during Dasara
content: Nine bus stands will be established in different areas of the city to cater to suburban and city routes

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Inside Seth Rollins' 'injury,' the biggest deception in WWE history
